name: querySome
syntax: querySome(query, function(row [, currentRow] [, query] ){} [, parallel] [, maxThreads])
description: This function calls a given closure/function with every element in a given query and returns true, if one of the closure calls returns true

params.name: callback
params.description: Closure or a function reference that will be called for each of the iteration.

callback_params.description: A struct with all of the columns for the current iteration
callback_params.name: row

callback_params.description: The value for the current iteration
callback_params.name: currentRow

callback_params.description: A reference of the original struct
callback_params.name: query

params.name: parallel
params.description: Lucee4.5+ true if the items can be executed in parallel

params.name: maxThreads
params.description: Lucee4.5+ the maximum number of threads to use when parallel = true

examples.title: The simple Querysome example
examples.description: Here,we've example to check whether the 75 is exists or not in myquery mark column value.
examples.code:
<cfscript>
 var myQuery = queryNew("id,name,mark","integer,varchar,integer",[[1,"Rahu",75],[2,"Ravi",80]]);
 result = querySome(myQuery , function(details){
	 return details.mark IS 75;
 });
 writeOutput((result ? "Some" : "No") & " matches  Record found!");
</cfscript>

examples.title: The Query Member Function example
examples.description: Here,we've example to check whether the 85 is exists or not in myquery mark column value using query member function.
examples.code:
<cfscript>
 var myQuery = queryNew("id,name,mark","integer,varchar,integer",[[1,"Rahu",75],[2,"Ravi",80]]);
 result = myQuery.Some(function(details){
	 return details.mark IS 85;
 });
 writeOutput((result ? "Some" : "No") & " matches  Record found!");
</cfscript>
